Complete the following questions to practice the skills you have learned in this lesson.

  1. What is the \(x\)-coordinate of the vertex of the graph that represents \(y=(x−2)^2−8\)?

Enter your answer here.

Correct! 2. The \(x\)-coordinate of the vertex is found by using the squared term of the vertex form. The value of the \(x\)-coordinate of the vertex of the graph is 2.

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activities 7.16.2–7.16.4. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is 2. The \(x\)-coordinate of the vertex is found by using the squared term of the vertex form. The value of the \(x\)-coordinate of the vertex of the graph is 2. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. What is the \(y\)-coordinate of the vertex of the graph that represents \(y=(x−2)^2−8\)?

Enter your answer here.

Correct! -8. In vertex form, the \(y\)-coordinate of the vertex is the constant. The value of the \(y\)-coordinate of the vertex of the graph is -8.

Try again. Why don't you go back to activities 7.16.2–7.16.4 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is -8. In vertex form, the \(y\)-coordinate of the vertex is the constant. The value of the \(y\)-coordinate of the vertex of the graph is -8. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. Where is the \(y\)-intercept for the equation \(y=(x−2)^2−8\) located?

Enter your answer here.

Correct! -4. Substitute 0 for \(x\) and you get \(y=(0−2)^2−8=4−8=-4\).

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activities 7.16.2–7.16.4. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is -4. Substitute 0 for \(x\) and you get \(y=(0−2)^2−8=4−8=-4\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. Which of the following is another point on the graph of the equation \(y=(x−2)^2−8\)?

Correct! \((4,-4)\). The \(y\)-intercept is 2 horizontal units to the left of the vertical line containing the vertex (the axis of symmetry). Using the symmetry of the graph, another point with the same \(y\)-coordinate is located 2 horizontal units to the right of the vertical line containing the vertex.

Try again. Why don't you go back to activity 7.16.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is: \((4,-4)\). The \(y\)-intercept is 2 horizontal units to the left of the vertical line containing the vertex (the axis of symmetry). Using the symmetry of the graph, another point with the same \(y\)-coordinate is located 2 horizontal units to the right of the vertical line containing the vertex. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. Which graph a representation of \(y=(x - 6)^2 - 5\)?

Correct! Yes graph A

The correct answer is Yes. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. The function \(v\) is defined by \(v(x)=12(x+5)^2−7\).

Without graphing, determine if the vertex of the graph representing \(v\) shows the minimum or maximum value of the function.

Correct! The vertex shows the minimum value. The \(a\)-value, or the coefficient of the squared term is positive, so the graph opens upward.This means the \(y\)-coordinate of the vertex is the minimum value of the function. The vertex is at \((-5,-7)\). To verify your response, enter a couple of \(x\) -values on either side of -5 into the function. For example, find \(v(-6)\) and \(v(-4)\). Each time, the output is greater than \(v(-5)\).

Try again. Why don't you go back to activity 7.14.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is: The vertex shows the minimum value. The \(a\)-value, or the coefficient of the squared term is positive, so the graph opens upward.This means the \(y\)-coordinate of the vertex is the minimum value of the function. The vertex is at \((-5,-7)\). To verify your response, enter a couple of \(x\) -values on either side of -5 into the function. For example, find \(v(-6)\) and \(v(-4)\). Each time, the output is greater than \(v(-5)\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?
